title: Sabrina Malheiros
text:
Sabrina Malheiros (born 1979) is a Brazilian <a href="Musica%20Popular%20Brasileira">MPB</a> singer/songwriter. Her music has been described as "<a href="nu%20bossa">nu bossa</a>", combining <a href="house%20music">house</a> beats with <a href="jazz">jazz</a> and <a href="samba">samba</a> influences and "cool, detached-sounding vocals", and critics have compared her to <a href="Music%20of%20Brazil">Brazilian</a> contemporaries <a href="Bebel%20Gilberto">Bebel Gilberto</a> and <a href="C%C3%A9U">Céu</a>.
Biography.
Malheiros was born in the city of <a href="Rio%20de%20Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a>. She is the daughter of <a href="Azymuth">Azymuth</a> bassist <a href="Alex%20Malheiros">Alex Malheiros</a>. She was interested in music from a young age, enrolled in music school at age six, and made her first studio recording before age seven. She cites <a href="Azymuth">Azymuth</a> and <a href="Jo%C3%A3o%20Gilberto">João Gilberto</a> as early influences on her musical style.
Malheiros's first commercially distributed recording was the title track of Azymuth's 1991 album "<a href="Curumim">Curumim</a>", on which she sang lead vocals. Her debut album, "Equilibria", was released in 2005. Malheiros wrote or co-wrote nine tracks on the album. Her second album, "New Morning", was released in 2008 and was arranged by <a href="Arthur%20Verocai">Arthur Verocai</a>. Both albums were produced by Daniel Maunick and released on the <a href="Far%20Out%20Recordings">Far Out Recordings</a> label. A remastered and partially reworked "Deluxe Edition" of "New Morning" was released in 2009, containing a few extra tracks and an increased emphasis on instrumentation.
Malheiros made her UK concert debut on 18 May 2005 at Jazz Cafe in <a href="London">London</a>.
